result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony S. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $100.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No DNA sample and/or surcharge is assessed as Defendant previously provided the same through another felony conviction.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony S. Adams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Anthony S. Adams in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Questions as to status of counsel.  Per Def:  He had not had enough time to retain his own counsel and requests to speak directly with the State.  Court will accept voluntary waiver of counsel to allow for discussions with ADA.  Off Record for discussion.  Back of Record @ 3:23 PM:  Per ADA - resolution reached and recited.  Def confirms resolution has been reached.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea POP: NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Accepts resolution offered and imposes Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge ordered by the Court - bond to be applied - 60 DTP any balance.  Sample already on file.  Appeal Rights Given.
Status conference on June 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:55 PM: Defendant Anthony S. Adams in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Def wants counsel and will retain his own attorney.  Court will proceed with that understanding.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
